text:
Mr. [**Known lastname 3957**] is a 74 year old male with a history of ulcerative colitis
   now on prolonged immunosuppressive therapy, coronary artery disease and
   non-small cell lung cancer s/p VATs and left upper lobectomy in
   [**2146-11-4**] who is transferred to the ICU for increasing oxygen
   requirements and tacypnea.Patient was continued on solumedrol and also
   given cyclosporine.  Also found to have left DVT and started heparin
   and bridged to coumadin.  On [**12-5**], decreased oxygen saturation and
   dyspnea.  CT scan on [**12-6**] revealed left hydropneumothorax and also
   bilateral infiltrates consistent with multi-focal pneumonia.  Started
   on levofloxacin and flagyl and then started Vancomycin and zosyn [**12-7**]
   Over past 48 hours, oxygenation has worsened.  Also, had drop in
   hematocrit from 27 to 22 this am. Transfused with 2 units prbc.
   Delirium / confusion
   Assessment:
   Difficult to assess at times d/t tachypnea, wearing mask, hard to hear
   with mask on. Lethargic but easily arousable. Oriented x3 with cueing.
   No signs of agitation but does require calming down after repositioned
   as he gets very winded and desats if mask off even for a few seconds.
   Reported by night nurse to have appeared
sundowning
 over the last
   several nights. Cooperative with care this shift.
   Action:
   Oriented with cueing. Safety precautions with bed alarm on, 3 side
   rails up, call light within reach.
   Response:
   Oriented and cooperative with care
   Plan:
   Continue to assess mental status, reorient prn, safety precautions.
   Anemia, acute, secondary to blood loss (Hemorrhage, Bleeding)
   Assessment:
   Am hct was 22. pt lethargic but arousable. Oriented x3, sbp in
   90s-100s. remains tachycardic in 100s with frequent pvcs. 2  15 beat
   runs vtach-pt asymptomatic. Am k 4.0, mag 1.9, phosphate 2.4. no bm
   today-pt did try on bedpan today.
   Action:
   Received 2 units prbc (one on previous shift and one this shift).
   Magnesium, calcium repleted. Phosphate being repleted with iv kphos.
   Response:
   Pm hct stable at 28.7, pm k 8.1 not hemolyzed-repeat k sent off venous
   blood gas: 4.1. ionlized calcium 1.12. ekg with no changes [**Name8 (MD) **] md.
   Plan:
   Continue to monitor hct, guaiac all stool, monitor and replete lytes.
   Impaired Skin Integrity
   Assessment:
   Pt with documented stage 2 pressure ulcer on coccyx-last changed on
   days [**12-8**] with duoderm gel and allyven. Also with old areas of
   dehision on left mid axillary area from vats with tegaderm in upper
   area and nu-gauze and 4x4 in lower area, intact.
   Action:
   Wound care rn up to change dressings. Coccyx dressing a stage 3
   wound care note for details. Aquacell applied until aquacell ag
   available. 4x4 and softsorb on top of aquacell. Tegaderm left on upper
   area of left mid axillary area. Dressing on lower part of axilla
   changed with duoderm gel applied on wound with 4x4 on top.
   Response:
   Wounds appear more extensive than last documented.
   Plan:
   Continue dressing changes daily to coccyx and left mid axillary area as
   directed. Wound care rn to follow prn.
   Respiratory failure, acute (not ARDS/[**Doctor Last Name 11**])
   Assessment:
   Lungs diminished with crackles at bases. Occasionally with scattered
   wheezing. Desats very easily with any exertion to the mid  to upper 80s
   even with mask on. Desats to low 80s with mask off-pt found with mask
   off intermittently. Dry cough. Pt slightly restless in early evening
   but easily redirected. Had witnessed aspiration last eve. Over 1 liter
   positive.
   Action:
   Pt encouraged to cough and deep breathe. Vbg in afternoon: 7.51/30/27
   (abg in am was 7.57/26/139). Speech and swallow eval deferred d/t
   witnessed aspiration while drinking yesterday. Given 20mg iv lasix.
   Response:
   Continues to desat with minimal activity, remains alkalotic but
   acceptable vbg. Diuresing well in early afternoon but still 500cc +.
   Given an additional 20mg iv Lasix at 18:30, awaiting response.
   Plan:
   Monitor resp status, encourage to cough and deep breathe, iv abx.
   Continue to monitor fluid status with goal of 1 liter negative.
